title: United States presidential vacations
text:
United States presidential vacations, or vacations taken by the <a href="presidents%20of%20the%20United%20States">presidents of the United States</a>, have often been contentious.
History.
Since the time of <a href="Ulysses%20S.%20Grant">Ulysses S. Grant</a> in 1874, <a href="Martha%27s%20Vineyard">Martha's Vineyard</a> has been a popular vacation site for presidents. Presidents who have taken a vacation there include Presidents <a href="John%20F.%20Kennedy">John F. Kennedy</a>, <a href="Bill%20Clinton">Bill Clinton</a>, and <a href="Barack%20Obama">Barack Obama</a>.
The presidential vacations can be risky in terms of popularity and practical safety:
Known totals.
